attributes.action: legislate for the harmonisation of prices offered by services such as iTunes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The price of a regular iTunes music download in the United Kingdom is 79p whereas in the United States for example, they are priced at 99 cents. We the undersigned believe that this constitutes unacceptable price discrimination and abuse of market share as iTunes is the sole provider of many  commercial downloadable tracks and we the consumers are unable to purchase downloads from the United States service instead.
We the undersigned believe that progress on this issue is important because it is likely that services such as iTunes will become more important as a distribution mechanism as time advances, in the realms of cinema and television as well as music.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
